alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Lauderdale (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 09 at 12:53PM CST until December 09 at 1:15PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CST FOR CROCKETT...SOUTHEASTERN DYER...SOUTHWESTERN GIBSON...EAST CENTRAL LAUDERDALE AND NORTH CENTRAL HAYWOOD COUNTIES... At 1253 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Chestnut Bluff, or 13 miles north of Brownsville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Humboldt, Trenton, Alamo, Halls, Chestnut Bluff, Eaton, Maury City, Friendship, Gates, Gadsden, Hawkinsville, Quincy, Gibson Wells, Central, Frog Jump, Currie, Brazil, Maury Junction, Coxville, and Crockett Mills. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for west Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
